title: Engenheiro (a) de Sistemas Sr. (Foco em Desenvolvimento de Software SAP)
description:
Sinta a nossa energia!


Somos um time de 16 mil colaboradores próprios, espalhados por 18 estados brasileiros e no Distrito Federal. Aqui, os sotaques se misturam, integração, colaboração e segurança são elementos fundamentais em nosso dia a dia. Atuamos em toda a cadeia do setor elétrico brasileiro, Geração, Transmissão, Distribuição e Comercialização. Juntos, somos essa Neoenergia toda!

Queremos liderar a transição energética no Brasil e ser a escolha número 1 para brasileiros e brasileiras. E faremos isso com pessoas de todos os gêneros, raças, idades, orientações sexuais e com deficiências. Investimos em diversidade, inovação e tecnologias para oferecer a melhor experiência de soluções energéticas conectadas a cada um dos nossos 16 milhões de clientes!


Sua energia será muito importante para:


Ser responsável por projetar, desenvolver e implementar soluções robustas na plataforma SAP. O profissional será responsável por customizações, integrações e otimizações dos módulos SAP, garantindo aderência aos processos de negócio e eficiência no uso da tecnologia., garantindo eficiência, segurança e escalabilidade. Trabalhará em colaboração com diferentes frentes de negócio para desenvolver soluções, sempre alinhadas às melhores práticas, às regras de LGPD, fluxo de desenvolvimento seguro e aos objetivos estratégicos da empresa.


Atividades:


  • Projetar, desenvolver e manter soluções SAP utilizando ABAP, Fiori/UI5, SAP HANA e outras tecnologias relevantes;
  • Criar e modificar programas, relatórios e interfaces para atender às necessidades do negócio;
  • Trabalhar na integração do SAP com outros sistemas e APIs;
  • Implementar melhorias e otimizações em processos empresariais dentro do SAP;
  • Realizar troubleshooting e suporte técnico para resolver incidentes e garantir a estabilidade das soluções SAP;
  • Colaborar com consultores funcionais e usuários para entender requisitos e propor soluções eficazes;
  • Aplicar as melhores práticas de desenvolvimento e segurança em ambiente SAP;
  • Participar do planejamento e estimativa de tarefas em metodologias ágeis (Scrum/Kanban);
  • Prezar pelos valores de Saúde, Segurança, Sustentabilidade, e Meio Ambiente disseminados pela companhia por meio de campanhas e políticas, aplicando seus princípios em todas as ações, processos e diretrizes da empresa.



Para fazer parte do nosso time, você precisa ter:


Requisitos Obrigatórios:

  • Ensino Superior completo em Engenharia de Computação, Engenharia de Software ou outras Engenharias;
  • Inglês avançado;
  • Espanhol Intermediário;
  • Vivência sólida em desenvolvimento ABAP (Reports, ALV, SmartForms, BAPIs, BADIs, User Exits);
  • Conhecimento em SAP Fiori/UI5 e SAP Gateway;
  • Vivência com SAP HANA e modelagem de dados CDS Views;
  • Conhecimento de integrações via IDocs, RFC, OData e Web Services;
  • Conhecimento em S/4HANA e sua estrutura tecnológica;
  • Conhecimento em Module Pool, Web dynpro e SAP Script;
  • Vivência em performance tuning e otimização de código SAP;
  • Vivência no uso de ferramentas de versionamento de código (Git, CTS+);
  • Conhecimento em automação de processos no SAP (BPM, RPA);


Requisitos Desejáveis:

  • Conhecimento em SAP S/4 HANA.


Para você ficar com a energia lá em cima, confira nossos benefícios:


  • Plano de Saúde e Odontológico para cuidar de você e de seus dependentes.
  • Vale Alimentação para fazer aquele mercado reforçado ou Vale Refeição para confraternizar com os colegas no horário de almoço;
  • Participação nos Lucros e Resultados da empresa, o momento mais esperado do ano;
  • Licença maternidade estendida, para um puerpério com mais tranquilidade;
  • Licença paternidade, para ficar bem perto da sua família nos primeiros dias do bebê;
  • Licença para casais homoafetivos, porque aqui reconhecemos todos os tipos de família;
  • Gympass para você fazer atividade física e ficar cheio de energia;
  • Programa de Idiomas para você poder se aperfeiçoar em outro idioma;
  • Auxílio Creche para te apoiar com o cuidado dos seus filhos;
  • Previdência Privada para você ter um futuro mais tranquilo;
  • Seguro de Vida para apoiar nossos colaboradores em todos os momentos.

title: Linux System Administrator
description:
We are looking for a OpenShift Infrastructure Administrator to relocate to LISBON .

This will be at least 3 years project, full-onsite, in Lisbon.

We will assist you in the emigration process.

You will be responsible for the implementation, administration, and maintenance of OpenShift environments:

  • Implementation and Administration
  • Infrastructure Management and Automation
  • Monitoring and Troubleshooting
  • Integration and Security



Requirements

  • Proven experience in OpenShift and Kubernetes administration.
  • Solid knowledge of Linux operating systems (RHEL preferred).
  • Experience with containerization technologies (Docker, CRI-O, Podman).
  • Knowledge in infrastructure automation with Ansible and Terraform.
  • Familiarity with persistent storage solutions in OpenShift.
  • Experience in networking, load balancing, and connectivity troubleshooting.
  • Knowledge of monitoring and logging tools (Prometheus, Grafana, ELK).
  • Experience with CI/CD in OpenShift environments.
  • OpenShift Certification (OCP, CKA, CKAD) is a plus.

title: HR Business Partner - Remote
description:
Recognized as the leading software development company in the Americas, our client offers 100% remote modality and an excellent work environment in which employees can thrive, work in multicultural teams, with flexible schedules and endless growth opportunities.


About the Role:


We are looking for a HR Business Partner to join our Human Resources team. We are looking for proactive, dynamic people and team players, with great organizational capacity, accustomed to handle multiple tasks and with marked attention to details. It is an excellent opportunity for those professionals looking to develop in one of the fastest growing companies in the industry!


What You’ll Do:


- Hold regular meetings with the respective business units and management, providing guidance on HR issues.

- Analyze trends and metrics related to the level of rotation in order to develop solutions, programs and policies to increase retention.

- Stay updated on the legal requirements related to the daily management of employees, giving priority to the reduction of legal risks and guaranteeing regulatory compliance.

- Provide guidance and assistance in interpreting HR policies.

- Solve complex problems of various kinds related to employees.

- Assist international employees with expatriation assignments and HR-related matters.


You Must Have:


- Previous experience in similar positions within the area.

- Knowledge of the labor regulations of Argentina and Latin America.

- Communication skills.

- Experience in the IT industry or regional responsibility (desirable).

- Advanced English level.


Benefits:


- 100% remote work.

- Flexible hours - make your own schedule!

- Diverse and multicultural work environment.

- Paid parental leave, vacation & holidays.

- Hardware setup for you to work from home.

- Excellent compensation — well above the market average.

- Extensive opportunities for growth and professional development thanks to our mentoring system.


Enjoy the opportunity to have a dynamic lifestyle, better health, and wellness. Find renewed passion in your job, improve your productivity, and benefit from attractive growth opportunities for your career.


If you are interested in being part of a team composed of the best professionals and working 100% goal-oriented in an innovative environment, but with the structure and resources of a multinational market leader, do not hesitate to apply!

title: React Developer - Remote
description:
At INDI, we're passionate about empowering individuals and businesses worldwide. Our cutting-edge recruiters connect leading companies with top talent, fostering a dynamic environment where innovation thrives. Join us in shaping the future of work.


About the Role:

Step into the world of frontend excellence as our React Developer, where you'll craft stunning user interfaces and functionality for innovative web applications. This isn't just about coding - it's about creating immersive digital experiences that delight users while collaborating with elite professionals across various cutting-edge industries.


What will I do?

Design and implement responsive user interfaces using React.js.

Develop reusable components and libraries for future use.

Transform UI/UX designs into high-quality, functional code.

Optimize application performance and responsiveness.

Collaborate with backend developers to integrate frontend with API services.

Participate in code reviews and implement best practices.

Stay at the forefront of emerging trends and technologies in frontend development.

Write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code.


Required skills and qualifications:

3+ years of experience with React.js and JavaScript/TypeScript.

Strong understanding of frontend fundamentals (HTML, CSS, JavaScript).

Experience with state management libraries (Redux, Context API, MobX).

Knowledge of modern frontend build tools and workflows.

Familiarity with RESTful APIs and integration patterns.

Experience with responsive design and cross-browser compatibility.

Understanding of UI/UX design principles.

Ability to write clean, efficient, and maintainable code.

Advanced English proficiency.


Benefits:

• Flexibility: Choose where and how you work for enhanced creativity and innovation.

• Tailored Compensation: Personalize your earnings to suit your financial goals.

• Tech-Driven Tools: Access cutting-edge resources for seamless collaboration and productivity.

• Autonomous Workflow: Take control of your schedule to achieve work-life balance.

• Well-being: Enjoy generous leave policies for rest and rejuvenation.

• Diversity & Inclusion: Thrive in a diverse and inclusive environment.

• Collaboration: Engage with industry leaders for collective growth.

• Development: Access mentorship and growth opportunities for continuous advancement.


If you are interested in being part of a team composed of the best professionals and working 100% goal-oriented in an innovative environment, but with the structure and resources of a multinational market leader, do not hesitate to apply!

title: Lead Data Engineer
description:
• NOTE:- This Job is only open to applicants located in Brazil.
  • This position is with a US-based client. Strong English communication skills are mandatory. Candidates must be comfortable working in the PST (Pacific Standard Time) zone.


About the Role

We’re looking for a Lead Data Engineer to join our growing Data & Analytics team. You’ll play a critical role in designing, building, and optimizing the infrastructure that powers our data products and insights. This is a hands-on leadership role where you’ll drive technical direction, mentor team members, and ensure the reliability and scalability of our data systems.



What you will do

  • Lead the design and development of robust, scalable, and secure data pipelines and workflows.
  • Own and evolve our data architecture, ensuring it supports current and future business needs.
  • Collaborate cross-functionally with data analysts, data scientists, and business
  • stakeholders to understand requirements and deliver data solutions.
  • Manage and enhance data ingestion and transformation processes using tools like Fivetran, Airflow, and Python.
  • Oversee data warehouse design and optimization using Snowflake and AWS services.
  • Promote best practices in data modeling, ETL/ELT design, and data governance.
  • Enable efficient and consistent reporting by ensuring well-structured datasets for Tableau and other BI tools.
  • Mentor junior engineers and foster a culture of technical excellence and continuous learning.


Tech Stack You’ll Work With

  • Languages & Tools: Python, SQL
  • Data Orchestration: Apache Airflow
  • Data Integration: Fivetran
  • Data Warehousing: Snowflake
  • BI & Visualization: Tableau
  • Cloud Platform: AWS (e.g., S3, Lambda, EC2, etc.)
  • Version Control & CI/CD: Git, GitHub Actions


What We’re Looking For

  • 7+ years of experience in data engineering, with at least 1–2 years in a technical leadership role.
  • Strong knowledge of modern data architectures, including ELT pipelines, data lakes, and warehousing.
  • Proficiency in Python and SQL; experience building data pipelines and automations.
  • Deep experience with Snowflake or similar cloud-based data warehouses.
  • Experience with cloud platforms like AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure and best practices.
  • Proven experience with Airflow or similar orchestration tools.
  • Understanding of data modeling techniques and performance optimization strategies.
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to explain complex data topics to non-technical stakeholders.


Preferred Qualifications

  • This Job is only open to applicants located in Brazil.
  • Exposure to Kafka or other streaming data platforms.
  • Familiarity with data privacy, compliance, and governance frameworks.
  • Experience collaborating with data science teams and understanding machine learning workflows.
  • Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) to communicate insights effectively.


Why Join Us

As a Lead Data Engineer with us, you'll engage in solving some of the most compelling

and complex problems in the data engineering landscape, including:

  • Handling Unstructured Data: Develop scalable solutions to process and analyze unstructured data from various sources, enabling meaningful insights from complex datasets.
  • Optimizing Real-Time Data Processing: Design and implement low-latency data pipelines using tools like Apache Kafka and Apache Flink to support real-time applications in domains such as autonomous vehicles and smart grids.
  • Ensuring Data Integrity and Lineage: Establish comprehensive data lineage systems to track data origins, transformations, and movements, facilitating error detection and compliance auditing.
  • Scalability and Performance Optimization: Address challenges related to processing large datasets, optimizing query performance, and ensuring efficient data storage and retrieval in cloud environments.

title: Lead Data Engineer
description:
• NOTE:- This Job is only open to applicants located in Brazil.

About the Role

We’re looking for a Lead Data Engineer to join our growing Data & Analytics team. You’ll play a critical role in designing, building, and optimizing the infrastructure that powers our data products and insights. This is a hands-on leadership role where you’ll drive technical direction, mentor team members, and ensure the reliability and scalability of our data systems.



What you will do

  • Lead the design and development of robust, scalable, and secure data pipelines and workflows.
  • Own and evolve our data architecture, ensuring it supports current and future business needs.
  • Collaborate cross-functionally with data analysts, data scientists, and business
  • stakeholders to understand requirements and deliver data solutions.
  • Manage and enhance data ingestion and transformation processes using tools like Fivetran, Airflow, and Python.
  • Oversee data warehouse design and optimization using Snowflake and AWS services.
  • Promote best practices in data modeling, ETL/ELT design, and data governance.
  • Enable efficient and consistent reporting by ensuring well-structured datasets for Tableau and other BI tools.
  • Mentor junior engineers and foster a culture of technical excellence and continuous learning.


Tech Stack You’ll Work With

  • Languages & Tools: Python, SQL
  • Data Orchestration: Apache Airflow
  • Data Integration: Fivetran
  • Data Warehousing: Snowflake
  • BI & Visualization: Tableau
  • Cloud Platform: AWS (e.g., S3, Lambda, EC2, etc.)
  • Version Control & CI/CD: Git, GitHub Actions


What We’re Looking For

  • 7+ years of experience in data engineering, with at least 1–2 years in a technical leadership role.
  • Strong knowledge of modern data architectures, including ELT pipelines, data lakes, and warehousing.
  • Proficiency in Python and SQL; experience building data pipelines and automations.
  • Deep experience with Snowflake or similar cloud-based data warehouses.
  • Experience with cloud platforms like AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure and best practices.
  • Proven experience with Airflow or similar orchestration tools.
  • Understanding of data modeling techniques and performance optimization strategies.
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to explain complex data topics to non-technical stakeholders.


Preferred Qualifications

title: Data Analyst
description:
InComm is a global leader in the payments industry with over 30 years of experience and a presence in 30+ countries. As pioneers in gift cards, we hold two-thirds of the global market share. Our mission is to revolutionize global commerce through innovative payment technologies for retailers, brands, and consumers.


We’re looking for a Data Analyst to join our growing data team and help us transform data into actionable insights. This role is ideal for professionals who enjoy digging into complex datasets, building dashboards, and partnering with cross-functional teams to support data-driven decision-making.


Fluent or advanced English is required for daily communication with our international teams.


What You’ll Do:

  • Analyze and Visualize Data : Extract, transform, and analyze data using SQL Server, Excel, and Azure tools to support business decisions.
  • Build Reports and Dashboards : Develop reports and visualizations in Power BI and/or other BI tools to deliver insights to stakeholders.
  • Collaborate Across Teams : Work closely with product, engineering, and business teams to gather requirements and provide analytical support.
  • Ensure Data Accuracy : Validate data sources and ensure data integrity across reporting and analysis processes.
  • Support Data Pipelines : Collaborate with data engineers to understand and enhance data flows and ensure availability of reliable data.
  • Drive Continuous Improvement : Identify opportunities for automation and improved efficiency in data reporting and analysis.


What You Bring:

  • Solid experience in SQL Server and strong skills in writing SQL queries ;
  • Solid experience with Azure Synapse , Azure Data Factory , and data pipelines ;
  • Experience working with ETL tools (SSIS, Informatica, or similar) in collaboration with data engineering teams;
  • Proficiency in data visualization tools like Power BI or similar;
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to turn data into business insights;
  • Fluent or advanced English;
  • Bachelor’s degree in a related field (e.g., Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering, Economics);
  • 4+ years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role.


Nice to Have:

  • Basic understanding of DevOps practices and CI/CD concepts;
  • Knowledge of data warehousing and data modeling;
  • Experience with cloud-based environments (Azure preferred);
  • Familiarity with project management tools (JIRA, Confluence, etc.).


Benefits :

  • R$340 home office allowance
  • R$1,150 meal/food allowance (VR/VA)
  • 10% annual bonus
  • SulAmérica health/dental plan
  • Life insurance
  • Hardware provided
  • 100% remote
  • Educational support


If you’re passionate about data, love solving problems, and want to make a real impact in a global company, we’d love to meet you!


Apply today and help us turn data into decisions.

title: Senior Quality Assurance Engineer
description:
#SeniorQuality Assurance #Automation


✅ At BOZ we are in search of our next #Sr.Quality Assurance +Automation✅


Who are we?


At Boz, we pride ourselves on being a strategic partner for businesses looking to strengthen and optimize their IT teams. With over 15 years of experience, we provide access to a network of highly skilled IT professionals who specialize in various areas of technology. Our goal is to empower companies to scale their projects, reduce operational costs, and achieve their business objectives efficiently.


Whether your organization is in fintech, healthcare, retail, insurance, or telecommunications, Boz IT delivers the expertise you need to succeed in today's fast-paced digital environment. From software development and data science to cybersecurity and IT project management, our talent pool is diverse, certified, and ready to seamlessly integrate with your internal teams.


What are we looking for in you?


We are looking for a highly motivated #Sr.Quality Assurance Automation


Requirements:


5+ years of experience in functional testing within an agile software development

environment, including automation and performance testing experience

Intermediate to advanced knowledge of Postman for API testing (GET, POST, PUT,

DELETE, assertions).

Experience with test automation tools and scripting (e.g., Playwright, Lambdatest,

WinAppDriver, Selenium or similar)

Experience with performance testing tools (e.g., K6, LoadRunner, JMeter, or

similar)

Understanding of SDLC and STLC in a fast-paced environment.

Experience writing and executing test cases, test plans, and documenting defects.

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with keen attention to detail.

Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively within a cross

functional team.

English level B2-C1


What do we offer?


Payment in dollars

title: Executivo(a) de Contas
description:
Sobre a Empresa: Já pensou em prestar serviços para uma casa de estratégia e projetos de tecnologia avançada que reúne gente geek, gente criativa, e gente de negócios? A Hagens íntegra Comunicação, Alta Performance, HX Experience dentro de uma cultura que valoriza ideias, iniciativas, criatividade e, com certeza, as pessoas. Bora voar no nosso foguete!

Estamos localizados no coração de Campinas, em um dos maiores prédios da cidade na Norte Sul. Aqui, você encontrará um ambiente de inovação, com profissionais talentosos e criativos que desenvolvem soluções que realmente fazem a diferença.


Na Hagens, operamos em um modelo híbrido, combinando atuação remota com encontros presenciais às terças, quartas e quintas-feiras, ajustáveis conforme necessário.


Descrição da vaga:

Estamos em busca de um(a) Executivo(a) de Contas para atuar na gestão estratégica dos nossos clientes, garantindo o atendimento eficaz de suas necessidades de marketing e comunicação. Você será responsável por construir e manter relacionamentos sólidos com os clientes, entender profundamente seus desafios e objetivos de negócio, e propor soluções personalizadas que gerem valor real. Este papel é essencial para conectar as áreas internas da agência com os clientes, assegurando que todos os projetos sejam executados de forma eficiente e estratégica.

Buscamos alguém que combine pensamento estratégico com excelentes habilidades de relacionamento e comunicação.


Como vai ser seu dia a dia com a gente:

  • Gerenciar o relacionamento com clientes, garantindo uma comunicação clara, eficiente e estratégica.
  • Compreender profundamente os segmentos de atuação dos clientes, seus desafios e metas de negócio.
  • Desenvolver e interpretar briefings de forma clara e estratégica para as áreas internas da agência.
  • Identificar oportunidades e propor soluções que agreguem valor aos projetos e à parceria com o cliente.
  • Coordenar o fluxo de demandas, garantindo o cumprimento de prazos e a qualidade das entregas.
  • Realizar apresentações de propostas, reports de resultados e projetos para clientes.
  • Manter-se atualizado sobre tendências de mercado e melhores práticas de comunicação e marketing para trazer insights relevantes para os clientes.



Requisitos:

  • Experiência prévia em atendimento a clientes na área de marketing, publicidade ou comunicação.
  • Excelente capacidade de comunicação oral e escrita.
  • Habilidade para desenvolver e interpretar briefings estratégicos.
  • Capacidade de pensar de forma analítica e estratégica.
  • Habilidade de negociação e gestão de expectativas.
  • Organização e capacidade de administração de prazos e demandas simultâneas.
  • Capacidade de criar e manter relacionamentos de confiança com os clientes.
  • Conhecimento sobre tendências de marketing digital e comunicação integrada.


Diferenciais:

  • Vivência anterior com segmentos variados de mercado (varejo, tecnologia, saúde, etc.).
  • Experiência em plataformas de gestão de projetos (como Trello, Asana, Monday.com).
  • Conhecimento em planejamento estratégico de campanhas 360º.
  • Cursos e formações complementares em atendimento publicitário, negociação ou planejamento estratégico.
  • Experiência em condução de reuniões e apresentações para alta liderança de clientes.

Na Hagens, operamos em um modelo híbrido, combinando atuação remota com encontros presenciais às terças, quartas e quintas-feiras, ajustáveis conforme necessário.


Descrição da vaga:

Estamos em busca de um(a) Executivo(a) de Contas para atuar na gestão estratégica dos nossos clientes, garantindo o atendimento eficaz de suas necessidades de marketing e comunicação. Você será responsável por construir e manter relacionamentos sólidos com os clientes, entender profundamente seus desafios e objetivos de negócio, e propor soluções personalizadas que gerem valor real. Este papel é essencial para conectar as áreas internas da agência com os clientes, assegurando que todos os projetos sejam executados de forma eficiente e estratégica.

Buscamos alguém que combine pensamento estratégico com excelentes habilidades de relacionamento e comunicação.

  • Gerenciar o relacionamento com clientes, garantindo uma comunicação clara, eficiente e estratégica.

  • Desenvolver e interpretar briefings de forma clara e estratégica para as áreas internas da agência.
  • Identificar oportunidades e propor soluções que agreguem valor aos projetos e à parceria com o cliente.
  • Coordenar o fluxo de demandas, garantindo o cumprimento de prazos e a qualidade das entregas.
  • Realizar apresentações de propostas, reports de resultados e projetos para clientes.
  • Manter-se atualizado sobre tendências de mercado e melhores práticas de comunicação e marketing para trazer insights relevantes para os clientes.

title: Junior Java Developer - Remote
description:
At INDI, we're passionate about empowering individuals and businesses worldwide. Our cutting-edge recruiters connect leading companies with top talent, fostering a dynamic environment where innovation thrives. Join us in shaping the future of work.


About the Role:

We are looking for Junior Java Developer to join our Development team and participate in different projects made up of multicultural teams distributed throughout the world. We are looking for proactive people, team players passionate about programming in this language and oriented to provide the best experience to the end user. This is an excellent opportunity for those professionals looking to develop in one of the fastest-growing companies in the industry!


These developers will face numerous technical challenges, so they must use current technologies, and get involved in the mobile world, web applications, devices, etc.


Main Activities:

- Work with software development teams to gather requirements and ensure best practices are adhered.

- Design, Implement & Support solutions for application development, security, analytics, and performance management.

- Conform to existing industry security coding standards adhering to fortify scan and other security tool review requirements.

- Conduct code reviews for junior members of the team and do peer code reviews to make sure the code is following standards set forward by the architects.

- Run test scripts against code to ensure quality delivery.

- Resolve code issues with urgency.


Requirements:

- 1+ years of experience in Java.

- Experience in web application programming.

- Knowledge of Object Oriented Programming.

- Ability to work with relational and non-relational bases.

- Advanced English level.


Benefits:

• Flexibility: Choose where and how you work for enhanced creativity and innovation.

• Tailored Compensation: Personalize your earnings to suit your financial goals.

• Tech-Driven Tools: Access cutting-edge resources for seamless collaboration and productivity.

• Autonomous Workflow: Take control of your schedule to achieve work-life balance.

• Well-being: Enjoy generous leave policies for rest and rejuvenation.

• Diversity & Inclusion: Thrive in a diverse and inclusive environment.

• Collaboration: Engage with industry leaders for collective growth.

• Development: Access mentorship and growth opportunities for continuous advancement.


If you are interested in being part of a team composed of the best professionals and working 100% goal-oriented in an innovative environment, but with the structure and resources of a multinational market leader, do not hesitate to apply!

title: Risk Control Specialist
description:
Responsibilities

  • Assess and handle risk control alerts according to the SOP, ensuring the accuracy and timeliness of alert handling during work hours to avoid false positives and missed alerts.
  • Review user information and withdrawal requests.
  • Monitor changes in risk control rules of external competitors and provide corresponding suggestions based on existing rules.
  • Continuously learn platform rules and enhance personal professional skills.


Requirements

  • Bachelor's degree in Finance or a related field
  • Possess business sensitivity and awareness of risk
  • Strong psychological quality with effective communication and judgment skills
  • Strong logical thinking and data collection and analysis abilities
  • Strict adherence to professional ethics and information security and confidentiality in daily work
  • Available to work on weekends and with rotated shifts between day and overnight shifts
  • Proficiency in English. (Proficiency in Chinese is a plus)

title: Sr. Salesforce Developer - Data Cloud
description:
Born digital, UST transforms lives through the power of technology. We walk alongside our clients and partners, embedding innovation and agility into everything they do. We help them create transformative experiences and human-centered solutions for a better world.

UST is a mission-driven group of over 39,000+ practical problem solvers and creative thinkers in over 30+ countries. Our entrepreneurial teams are empowered to innovate, act nimbly, and create a lasting and sustainable impact for our clients, their customers, and the communities in which we live. With us, you’ll create a boundless impact that transforms your career—and the lives of people across the world.

Visit us at UST.com


Overall Experience:

• SFDC Senior System Analyst/Senior Developer: 5-6 years IT industry total experience, including hands on experience in Data Cloud.

• 3-4 years specifically in Salesforce.com development, and implementation, administration, and configuration.

• Excellent communication and be able to coordinate with and get Knowledge Transition from Onsite (USA based) salesforce development teams and interact with IT/Business stakeholders there.

• Good to have experience in different Salesforce clouds/offerings: Sales, Service, Community.

• Other cloud/offerings like Marketing/Pardot, Einstein AI, Analytics, FSL etc are a plus.


Salesforce.com Certification:

• Must Have: Data Cloud Consultant, Salesforce Platform Developer 1 and AppBuilder Certification • Desirable: Salesforce Integration Architect certification

• Good to Have: Advanced Admin (ADM301) or Consultant (Sales Cloud/Service Cloud) Certifications


Force.com Platform Development Skills Needed:

• Must Have: Experience working on at least one Data Cloud project, involving both design and implementation.

• Strong functional and technical expertise in Salesforce Data Cloud development.

• Experience with data modeling and data warehousing solutions.

• Design, develop, and implement solutions on Salesforce Data Cloud, ensuring performance, scalability, and data integrity.

• Strong hands-on experience with Salesforce Data Cloud including building and maintaining Data Streams, DMO, DLO, Data mapping, Calculated Insights, Segmentation, Activation etc

• Configure and manage Data Streams to ingest large volumes of data from multiple sources.

• Implement and manage Identity Resolution (IR) rules to ensure accurate and unified customer profiles.

• Develop and optimize Calculated Insights, Segmentation, and Activation processes to drive personalized customer experiences.

• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define and implement data strategies, data models, and data mapping.

• Ensure proper data governance and apply data quality best practices across the platform.

• Monitor system performance and proactively resolve technical issues related to Salesforce Data Cloud.

• Design and implement data integration solutions, leveraging Salesforce Data Cloud and other relevant tools.

• Create and maintain data models, schemas, and mappings for efficient data integration processes.

• Proficiency in SQL or other data query languages.

• Knowledge of data governance practices and ensuring data quality.

• Work closely with marketing and sales teams to activate segmented audiences in real-time across multiple channels, ensuring seamless data integration and customer engagement.


If you would like to know more, do not hesitate to apply and we’ll get in touch to fill you in details.


UST is waiting for you!

• Work closely with marketing and sales teams to activate segmented audiences in real-time across multiple channels, ensuring seamless data integration and customer engagement.


If you would like to know more, do not hesitate to apply and we’ll get in touch to fill you in details.


UST is waiting for you!

title: Sr. Salesforce Developer - Data Cloud
description:
Born digital, UST transforms lives through the power of technology. We walk alongside our clients and partners, embedding innovation and agility into everything they do. We help them create transformative experiences and human-centered solutions for a better world.

UST is a mission-driven group of over 39,000+ practical problem solvers and creative thinkers in over 30+ countries. Our entrepreneurial teams are empowered to innovate, act nimbly, and create a lasting and sustainable impact for our clients, their customers, and the communities in which we live. With us, you’ll create a boundless impact that transforms your career—and the lives of people across the world.

Visit us at UST.com


Overall Experience:

• SFDC Senior System Analyst/Senior Developer: 5-6 years IT industry total experience, including hands on experience in Data Cloud.

• 3-4 years specifically in Salesforce.com development, and implementation, administration, and configuration.

• Excellent communication and be able to coordinate with and get Knowledge Transition from Onsite (USA based) salesforce development teams and interact with IT/Business stakeholders there.

• Good to have experience in different Salesforce clouds/offerings: Sales, Service, Community.

• Other cloud/offerings like Marketing/Pardot, Einstein AI, Analytics, FSL etc are a plus.


Salesforce.com Certification:

• Must Have: Data Cloud Consultant, Salesforce Platform Developer 1 and AppBuilder Certification • Desirable: Salesforce Integration Architect certification

• Good to Have: Advanced Admin (ADM301) or Consultant (Sales Cloud/Service Cloud) Certifications


Force.com Platform Development Skills Needed:

• Must Have: Experience working on at least one Data Cloud project, involving both design and implementation.

• Strong functional and technical expertise in Salesforce Data Cloud development.

• Experience with data modeling and data warehousing solutions.

• Design, develop, and implement solutions on Salesforce Data Cloud, ensuring performance, scalability, and data integrity.

• Strong hands-on experience with Salesforce Data Cloud including building and maintaining Data Streams, DMO, DLO, Data mapping, Calculated Insights, Segmentation, Activation etc

• Configure and manage Data Streams to ingest large volumes of data from multiple sources.

• Implement and manage Identity Resolution (IR) rules to ensure accurate and unified customer profiles.

• Develop and optimize Calculated Insights, Segmentation, and Activation processes to drive personalized customer experiences.

• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define and implement data strategies, data models, and data mapping.

• Ensure proper data governance and apply data quality best practices across the platform.

• Monitor system performance and proactively resolve technical issues related to Salesforce Data Cloud.

• Design and implement data integration solutions, leveraging Salesforce Data Cloud and other relevant tools.

• Create and maintain data models, schemas, and mappings for efficient data integration processes.

• Proficiency in SQL or other data query languages.

• Knowledge of data governance practices and ensuring data quality.

• Work closely with marketing and sales teams to activate segmented audiences in real-time across multiple channels, ensuring seamless data integration and customer engagement.


If you would like to know more, do not hesitate to apply and we’ll get in touch to fill you in details.


UST is waiting for you!

title: Assistente de marketing
description:
A Cria e Conecta está com vaga aberta!


Vaga: Assistente de Marketing – Foco em Redes Sociais (PJ)

Curitiba | Modelo híbrido


Você respira redes sociais, adora planejar conteúdos e sabe transformar ideias em posts criativos e estratégicos? Então essa vaga é pra você!


Estamos procurando uma pessoa organizada, antenada e com vontade de crescer junto com a gente. O foco é atuar na criação, gestão e performance de conteúdos digitais para os nossos clientes (e para a própria Cria e Conecta também!).


O que você vai fazer no dia a dia:
  • Criar e manter o calendário editorial dos clientes e da agência
  • Escrever legendas, sugerir criativos e acompanhar a produção junto ao time de design
  • Agendar e publicar conteúdos nas redes (Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn, TikTok)
  • Monitorar comentários, interações e acompanhar o desempenho das postagens
  • Produzir relatórios mensais com resultados e insights
  • Participar de reuniões de planejamento e troca de ideias com o time


Requisitos:
  • Boa escrita e noção de linguagem adaptada para redes sociais
  • Conhecimento básico em ferramentas como Canva, Meta Business, mLabs, Google Drive
  • Organização e pró-atividade
  • Estar cursando ou ter formação em Marketing, Publicidade, Jornalismo ou áreas afins
Diferenciais que contam pontos:
  • Experiência com tráfego pago
  • Noções de edição de vídeo (Reels/TikTok)
  • Interesse por inovação, memes e tendências digitais
  • Vontade de aprender e colaborar em equipe

title: Estagiário de Marketing Digital e Growth
description:
Oi! Obrigado pela curiosidade


Estamos em busca de um estagiário para integrar nossa equipe.


A Zubale é uma empresa de tecnologia que habilita os varejistas a vencer no eCommerce na América Latina. Possui parceria com uma ampla gama de varejistas, desde supermercados, lojas especializadas, farmácias, lojas de departamento e marcas de moda, ajudamos essas empresas a se destacarem no eCommerce. Como? Temos três produtos principais:


  • Flexifleet: Marketplace de freelancers para realizar o picking, packing e envio de pedidos de eCommerce.
  • Software de Fulfillment de eCommerce.
  • Client Engagement Suite: software para engajamento de clientes.


Nosso objetivo em ajudar marcas e varejistas a melhorar a experiência em seus canais diretos de eCommerce, reduzir custos e aumentar o EBITDA.


Conseguimos um crescimento agressivo nos últimos anos, operando em 6 países: México, Brasil, Chile, Colômbia, Peru e Costa Rica, e completamos mais de 30 milhões de tarefas em nossa plataforma. Hoje atendemos mais de 100 clientes, temos milhares de freelancers engajados em nossa plataforma e operamos em milhares de lojas.


Responsabilidades:


  • Desenvolver e executar estratégias de growth para aumentar a base de usuários e a receita;
  • Planejar, implementar e monitorar campanhas de marketing digital em plataformas como Google Ads e Facebook Ads.
  • Análise e controle do funil de conversão para otimizar campanhas com o objetivo de melhorar métricas de conversão.
  • Colaborar com outras equipes para alinhar estratégias de crescimento.
  • Produzir relatórios diversos de performance e KPI’s pertinentes a Growth e Aquisição de usuários;
  • Criar conteúdo para redes sociais, ações de marketing (online e offline) e campanhas especiais para engajamento


O que estamos buscando:


  • Cursando graduação em Administração, Marketing, Publicidade e Propaganda e áreas afins.
  • Conhecimento de ferramentas de análise e métricas (Google Analytics, etc.).
  • Experiência com plataformas de anúncios (Google Ads, Facebook Ads, etc.).
  • Conhecimento em métricas de growth (LTV, CAC, Churn, etc) e métricas de mídia performance (CPC, CTR, CPL, etc)
  • Conhecimento em plataformas de CRM;
  • Excelente comunicação e habilidades interpessoais.
  • Inglês e/ou Espanhol desejável;



Envie seu currículo e venha construir soluções com a gente. Estamos ansiosos para te conhecer!

title: Senior PWA Engineer - React
description:
Senior PWA Engineer - React (PJ, 100 % remoto)

(Progressive Web Apps, backend Node.js, Python-friendly)


Ego Eimi - construindo o maior ecossistema de produtividade do mundo


Por que essa vaga é diferente?


  • Ganhe pelo resultado, não pelo relógio - R$ 10 mil por projeto/mês e liberdade para tocar quantos projetos quiser.
  • Rotina sem frescura - uma única call diária; o restante do tempo é totalmente assíncrono e flexível.
  • Férias ilimitadas - entregou? Então vá descansar, aprender ou viajar; você decide.
  • Stack moderna + salários de topo no Brasil - foco em React para PWAs, Node.js, Python, tooling de LLM (LangChain, CrewAI) e Cursor com MCPs.


Sobre a Ego Eimi


Nossa missão é “entregar soluções que elevem drasticamente a produtividade de pessoas e empresas.” Estamos caminhando para “tornar-nos o maior ecossistema de produtividade do planeta.”


Vivemos três valores centrais:


  • Obsessão em resolver problemas reais - tudo começa no usuário.
  • Cultivar autonomia - contratamos adultos que fazem o que precisa ser feito.
  • Be Nice - transparência, respeito e ética, sempre.


Se esses princípios ressoam em você, continue lendo.

title: Senior PWA Engineer - React
description:
Senior PWA Engineer - React (PJ, 100 % remoto)

(Progressive Web Apps, backend Node.js, Python-friendly)


Ego Eimi - construindo o maior ecossistema de produtividade do mundo


Por que essa vaga é diferente?


  • Ganhe pelo resultado, não pelo relógio - R$ 10 mil por projeto/mês e liberdade para tocar quantos projetos quiser.
  • Rotina sem frescura - uma única call diária; o restante do tempo é totalmente assíncrono e flexível.
  • Férias ilimitadas - entregou? Então vá descansar, aprender ou viajar; você decide.
  • Stack moderna + salários de topo no Brasil - foco em React para PWAs, Node.js, Python, tooling de LLM (LangChain, CrewAI) e Cursor com MCPs.


Sobre a Ego Eimi


Nossa missão é “entregar soluções que elevem drasticamente a produtividade de pessoas e empresas.” Estamos caminhando para “tornar-nos o maior ecossistema de produtividade do planeta.”


Vivemos três valores centrais:


  • Obsessão em resolver problemas reais - tudo começa no usuário.
  • Cultivar autonomia - contratamos adultos que fazem o que precisa ser feito.
  • Be Nice - transparência, respeito e ética, sempre.


Se esses princípios ressoam em você, continue lendo.

title: Product Manager
description:
XILO , a fast-growing Vertical AI company recently backed by a Series A financing round, is seeking a highly inquisitive and driven Product Manager to enhancethe experience of our SaaS platform and deliver impactful solutions to our customers.


About Us

Founded in 2019 by two best friends, Jon and Eli, XILO set out to revolutionize the insurance industry by solving its biggest challenges. Eli, a brokerage owner, brought invaluable industry expertise, while Jon, an experienced software engineer, saw an opportunity to innovate using technology. Initially launched as a vertical SaaS solution addressing core quoting challenges, XILO has since evolved into a trailblazing Vertical AI company leveraging the latest AI technology to transform the industry. By layering cutting-edge AI solutions onto its SaaS platform, XILO is driving innovation far beyond its original vision. Having recently closed our Series A funding round, XILO is growing rapidly and seeking talented individuals who want to do career-defining work in a mission-driven startup that’s at the forefront of AI innovation.


About The Role

As a Product Manager at XILO, you’ll be at the center of driving product improvements that directly impact our customers’ experience and businessoutcomes. You’ll collaborate with customers, engineers, and cross-functional teams to prioritize and implement new features, fix bugs, and enhance existingproducts. This role is perfect for a highly curious and tech-savvy individual who thrives in a fast-paced environment and is passionate about deliveringintuitive, self-service solutions that drive adoption and growth.


Key Responsibilities

  • Schedule and conduct 3 customer interviews weekly to gather actionablefeedback.
  • Plan and document 2 sprints of development ahead of Engineers, usingstandard prioritization processes.
  • Create product requirement documents for all assigned new features.
  • Work with design to design out each planned release phase (MVP, beta,full release)
  • Build data pipelines to measure customer adoption across multipleproducts accurately.
  • Enhance all current products to make them more intuitive and self-servicing.
  • Drive increased customer adoption across all products.
  • Improve sales pilot success rates to 80% by delivering exceptionalproduct experiences.


What we’re looking for

  • Extremely curious and inquisitive, with a passion for uncovering insightsthrough customer feedback.
  • Tech-savvy and comfortable learning complex systems quickly.
  • Process-driven thinker who sees everything as an opportunity tostreamline and improve.
  • Proven ability to conduct multiple customer interviews and synthesizefindings.
  • Quick learner who can master the industry and product at a fast pace.
  • Basic understanding of Engineering concepts to collaborate effectivelywith technical teams.
  • Works hard (10+ hours daily when needed) and embraces the challengesof a startup environment.
  • No ego and a mindset of continuous learning and improvement.
  • Relentless work ethic: doesn’t stop until the job is done and done right.
  • Builds genuine relationships with customers and teammates.
  • Positive, motivating, and supportive presence within the team.
  • Accountable for successes and failures, fostering a culture of ownership.
  • Balances leadership with hands-on contributions (player-coachmentality).
  • Passionate about AI and its transformative potential.
  • Experience with robust B2B SaaS products is required.
  • Familiar with JIRA, Agile/Scrum practices, PRD writing, and working with design and analytics tools.


What we offer

  • Collaborative and innovative work environment.
  • Flex PTO for any reason, including sick days (no specified limits), flexible work schedule.
  • Personal laptop.
  • Health and wellness package.
  • Budget for English lessons.


Why Join XILO?

Be part of a mission-driven team at the forefront of AI innovation and SaaS technology. As a Product Manager at XILO, you’ll have the opportunity to directly shape the evolution of our platform, improve customer experiences, and make a lasting impact on a rapidly growing company.


At XILO, we don’t stop until the job is done. If you’re ready to roll up your sleeves, embrace challenges, and make a meaningful impact, we’d love to hear from you. Apply only if you’re ready to invest in your success and build a lasting career.

  • Positive, motivating, and supportive presence within the team.
  • Accountable for successes and failures, fostering a culture of ownership.
  • Balances leadership with hands-on contributions (player-coachmentality).
  • Passionate about AI and its transformative potential.
  • Experience with robust B2B SaaS products is required.
  • Familiar with JIRA, Agile/Scrum practices, PRD writing, and working with design and analytics tools.


What we offer

  • Collaborative and innovative work environment.
  • Flex PTO for any reason, including sick days (no specified limits), flexible work schedule.
  • Personal laptop.
  • Health and wellness package.
  • Budget for English lessons.


Why Join XILO?

Be part of a mission-driven team at the forefront of AI innovation and SaaS technology. As a Product Manager at XILO, you’ll have the opportunity to directly shape the evolution of our platform, improve customer experiences, and make a lasting impact on a rapidly growing company.


At XILO, we don’t stop until the job is done. If you’re ready to roll up your sleeves, embrace challenges, and make a meaningful impact, we’d love to hear from you. Apply only if you’re ready to invest in your success and build a lasting career.

title: Lead 3D Animator - 3DS Max/Unreal Engine 5
description:
Company Description

Astral Clocktower Studios is a women-owned-and-operated indie game development studio headquartered on the East Coast of the US. We are currently developing our inaugural title, Kristala, a 3D dark fantasy action RPG built with Unreal Engine 5.

The game features anthropomorphic feline and rodent characters on the fantasy planet Ailur, a magical world devoid of humanity. Kristala offers fast-paced combat with a strong focus on story and lore, inviting players to explore a planet rich with untold stories.


Here's a recent gameplay trailer:


Role Description

We are seeking a Lead 3D Animator to take the reins of our animation department and help bring our fantastical characters to life. This is a full-time remote position. You’ll collaborate closely with game design and engineering to shape the feel of Kristala’s core gameplay from combat and traversal to cinematic storytelling.

Our ideal candidate is comfortable owning animation production and thrives in a creative, collaborative indie environment. Experience in 3DS Max and Unreal Engine 5 is preferred , though we’re open to animators with other specialties if they are capable of creating their own rigs.

What You'll Do

  • Lead and manage the animation department pipeline
  • Create agile, feline-inspired animations for both playable characters and enemies
  • Create various animations for monster-like characters
  • Implement and refine combat, traversal, and exploration animations with game design
  • Integrate motion capture data and enhance it with custom keyframe polish
  • Collaborate with our rigger (rigging experience would be a great bonus, but not required)
  • Solve animation implementation issues alongside the development team


Requirements

  • 3+ years of professional 3D animation experience (games preferred)
  • Strong proficiency in Unreal Engine
  • Advanced experience with 3DS Max (preferred) or other industry-standard tools
  • Fluent in English, with excellent communication and collaboration skills
  • Ability to work independently and take initiative in a remote setting
  • A Discord Account and experience using Discord


Bonus Points

  • Published game title(s) under your belt
  • Experience animating agile characters (ninja, feline, or parkour-like movement)
  • Experience working on an action-based, combat heavy kind of game in the past


While this role is currently offered as a contract position, our goal is to transition it into full-time employment as funding and milestones allow. We welcome applicants from anywhere in the world, as we are a worldwide, remote team. Strong communication and time zone flexibility are key.

title: Engenheiro de QA (Tosca + Selenium)
description:
ATENÇÃO!!!

LEIA ISSO ANTES:

Essa vaga foi lançada como "remoto" simplesmente para atingir pessoas de todo o Brasil que aceitem se mudar para Curitiba (PR). O cliente está inclusive oferecendo "signing bonus" para pessoas que topem de mudar, além de salário maior.


Forma de atuação: Presencial em Curitiba (PR)

Forma de contratação: CLT


  • Mandatório possui Inglês Avançado para Conversação!


Job Description: At Regions, the Quality Assurance (QA) Automation Engineer develops automated tests to validate the functionality of applications systems across various applications such as web, mobile, and mainframe.


Requirements:

- experience working as a functional automation engineer in quality assurance

- works in Selenium

- analysis requirements, acceptance criteria, and works with development and business teams to create test cases

- creates automation test cases to test functionality, acceptance criteria, and other scenarios

- Experience with MS SQL databases and general database querying


Benefícios

Vale refeição ou alimentação (R$ 925,00)

Assistência médica e odontológica

Seguro de Vida

Auxílio Creche

Vale Transporte

Participação nos Lucros

Licenças maternidade e paternidade estendidas

GymPass

Ginástica laboral

Oportunidades de capacitação, certificações, programas de línguas e parcerias com escolas de idiomas e universidades

Acesso a plataformas internas de educação corporativa, com 10.000 treinamentos e Udemy, com 40.000 treinamentos técnicos, com certificados reconhecidos mundialmente

Descontos para compras e cursos em rede de parceiros

Palestras e workshops: incentivo à saúde e bem-estar, oficinas de carreira, plano de desenvolvimento profissional e de liderança

Programa de Reconhecimento por tempo de empresa: comemoração com certificado + pontos no programa “Círculo de Vencedores”

title: Finance Analyst - Remote
description:
Recognized as the leading software development company in the Americas, our client offers 100% remote modality and an excellent work environment where employees can thrive, and work in multicultural teams, with flexible schedules and endless growth opportunities.


About the Role:


We are seeking a Finance Analyst to join our team and help drive our growth. As a Finance Analyst, you will play a critical and active role in the day-to-day operations. This is an excellent opportunity to be one of the key members of our team and position yourself for unique career growth opportunities.

What You’ll Do:


- Perform research and gather documentation to compile comprehensive reports delivering operational reports, and transactional tasks.

- Work with banking/financial entities, international agencies, or government officials.

- Assist in vendor and client registration, purchasing, and accounts payable processes.

- Data processing: responsible for updating records in the company system.

- Assist in the department's programs, projects, and processes.

- Assist in the preparation of monthly financial reports.

- Assist in tracking due dates and compliance with US tax returns and other legal requirements.


Here’s what we are looking for:


- 3+ years of experience working in finance areas.

- Expertise with web-based tools.

- Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

- Interpersonal and presentation skills.

- Organized and detail-oriented.

- Proven organizational skills.

- Advanced English, both spoken and written (a must).


Benefits:


- 100% remote work.

- Flexible hours - make your own schedule!

- Diverse and multicultural work environment.

- Paid parental leave, vacation & holidays.

- Hardware setup for you to work from home.

- Excellent compensation — well above the market average.

- Extensive opportunities for growth and professional development thanks to our mentoring system.


Enjoy the opportunity to have a dynamic lifestyle, better health, and wellness. Find renewed passion in your job, improve your productivity, and benefit from attractive growth opportunities for your career.


If you are interested in being part of a team composed of the best professionals and working 100% goal-oriented in an innovative environment, but with the structure and resources of a multinational market leader, do not hesitate to apply!

title: Consultor SAP SD Sênior
description:
Na Stefanini, acreditamos no poder da colaboração. Co-criamos soluções inovadoras em parceria com nossos clientes, combinando tecnologia de ponta, inteligência artificial e a criatividade humana. Estamos na vanguarda da resolução de problemas de negócios, proporcionando impacto real em escala global.


Ao se juntar à Stefanini, você se torna parte de uma jornada global de transformação. Estamos empenhados em criar impacto positivo não apenas nos negócios, mas também na vida de nossos colaboradores. Se você procura uma oportunidade de crescimento profissional em uma empresa que valoriza inovação, respeito, autonomia e parceria, você encontra aqui!


Junte-se a nós e seja parte da mudança!


Vaga: Consultor SAP SD sênior + Inglês avançado/Fluente

Local: Presencial em Londrina-PR

Modalidade: CLT


Atividades: O profissional sênior de SD oferece suporte de alto nível para SAP Vendas e Distribuição e integração com CRM. Sua expertise aprimora a precisão dos processos, reduz os tempos de resolução e contribui significativamente para a otimização dos processos de vendas e o aumento da satisfação dos clientes, graças ao tratamento eficiente de incidentes e solicitações complexas.


Requisitos:

• Oferece suporte funcional de alto nível para SAP SD/CRM.

• Lida com a resolução de problemas e aprimoramentos dos processos de vendas do SD e das integrações com CRM.

• Participa de forma proativa das melhorias contínuas.

• Forte expertise no módulo SAP SD, com conhecimento em CRM.

• Familiaridade com integrações e interfaces.

• Capacidade de documentar, analisar e comunicar de forma clara.


Obrigatório:

Ensino Superior

Inglês avançado/fluente (para comunicação)

Ter visto para EUA/Canada

Disponibilidade de viagens internacionais

title: Advogado júnior
description:
Quem somos?

A GFB Consulting foi criada para trazer inteligência e fornecer estratégia na tomada de decisões dos departamentos financeiros de empresas de médio porte. Nosso time é formado por especialistas financeiros egressos do mercado financeiro, empresas de tecnologia e empresas da economia real, como varejo, indústrias e serviços. Já fomos membros de comitês de investimentos e conselhos de fundos e empresas, CFOs e controllers, e estamos prontos para aportar todo esse conhecimento no negócio dos seus clientes.

Nosso sócios participaram de mais de BRL 4 bilhões em 100 operações bem sucedidas na carreira. Tais casos englobam investimentos de prviate equity e venture capital, M&A, FIDCs, dívidas estruturadas, recuperações judiciais e restruturação de dívidas. 


Sobre a Vaga

A GFB Consulting está em busca de um advogado junior com experiência em direito financeiro, recuperação judicial e/ou reestruturação de dívidas . A posição é destianda para a um projeto específico, sem dedicação exclusiva , de reestruturação de dívida em empresa em recuperação judicial.


O profissional será responsável por apoiar a elaboração e revisão de contratos da operação. Essa função temporária é alinhada ao nosso modelo de parceria com profissionais experientes que complementam nossa atuação técnica em momentos-chave das transações.


Responsabilidades

  • Elaboração e consolidação de comentários dos contratos da transação;
  • Participação de drafting sessions com as partes;
  • Condução de diligência societária da devedora e garantidoras, bem como elaboração dos atos societários;
  • Coordenação dos registros dos contratos da transação;
  • Comunicações gerais com as partes;

Pré-requisitos:

  • Experiência com elaboração e revisão de contratos;
  • Conhecimentos básicos de FIDCs;
  • Conhecimentos básicos de processos de recuperação judicial;

Expectativa de Conclusão do Projeto: até 20 dias.

title: Director / VP of Mergers & Acquisitions (Remote) – Enduring Ventures
description:
About Enduring Ventures

Enduring Ventures is a permanent capital holding company inspired by Berkshire Hathaway. We acquire and grow wonderful businesses in distressed, carve-out or divestiture situations. We are very hands on investors and our preferred holding period is forever—we’re not in the business of flipping companies, we’re in the business of compounding value for the long term.


Today, we own 20+ companies across software, home services, education, wellness, and hospitality—including independent hotel brands in Zion National Park and the Hamptons. We operate with a bias toward action, extreme ownership, and long-term alignment.


We prioritize hunger, humility, and horsepower. If you’ve built something from scratch, outworked everyone around you, or carried real weight in a high-stakes environment—we want to meet you.


Role Summary: Director/VP of M&A


We are seeking a mid- to senior-career M&A professional to lead our acquisition efforts. As the Director/VP of Mergers & Acquisitions, you will spearhead deal evaluation and execution for Enduring Ventures’ growing portfolio of companies. This is a remote role (preference for candidates based in Brazil, Colombia, or Argentina to align with our Americas operations).


You will draw on your extensive M&A experience—ideally honed at a top-tier firm (Big Four or equivalent)—to drive end-to-end deal processes. M&A expertise is absolutely critical for this position, including due diligence, financial modeling, deal preparation, and post-acquisition financial improvement initiatives.


The ideal candidate has a demonstrated history of executing deals in high-caliber environments (e.g., Big 4 transaction services or leading investment banks) and is ready to apply those skills in an entrepreneurial, long-term investment context.


What’s In It For You

  • Lead High-Impact Deals – Work directly with founders and partners on acquisitions that have real consequences.
  • Remote, Global, Flexible – Operate from anywhere while working on international deals.
  • No Bureaucracy, Full Autonomy – Own deals from end to end with a voice at the table.
  • Long-Term Capital Mindset – Buy great businesses to own forever with aligned incentives.
  • Direct Access to Decision Makers – Report directly to the Managing Partners.
  • Get Paid Like an Owner – Competitive base plus bonuses tied to long-term value creation.
  • Learn by Doing, Grow by Building – Help improve and grow real-world companies post-acquisition.
  • Mission-Aligned Culture – Join a team focused on building enduring value with discipline and purpose.


Key Responsibilities

Lead End-to-End M&A Processes

  • Manage acquisitions across a range of situations, including carveouts and distressed assets.
  • Navigate ambiguity and engage with non-institutional sellers.

Financial Due Diligence

  • Conduct rigorous diligence on targets in non-standard environments.
  • Identify hidden liabilities, off-balance-sheet risks, and working capital issues.

M&A Deal Preparation

  • Craft investment memos and financial narratives.
  • Structure deals to address seller concerns such as earn-outs and financing.

Post-Acquisition Financial Integration & Improvement

  • Stabilize and improve performance in newly acquired companies.
  • Build reporting structures and prioritize 100-day financial wins.

Financial Modeling & Valuation

  • Build and refine financial models.
  • Present valuation analyses using DCF, comparables, and ROI projections.

Negotiation & Transaction Execution

  • Lead negotiations with sellers and legal teams.
  • Maintain momentum and alignment through closing.

Cross-Functional Leadership

  • Coordinate analysts, attorneys, accountants, and consultants.
  • Mentor junior team members.

Strategic Input

  • Help refine M&A strategy.
  • Identify sectors/geographies of interest and build deal flow partnerships.

Qualifications & Experience

  • M&A Expertise : 10+ years in M&A, corporate finance, or transaction advisory. Top-tier firm experience required.
  • GAAP Accounting Fluency Required – A deep understanding of GAAP is critical for this role. You will need to assess financial statements with precision, uncover hidden liabilities, and structure deals that anticipate accounting impacts. Candidates must demonstrate fluency in U.S. GAAP and comfort analyzing non-standard or unaudited financials in complex situations.
  • Track Record of Complex Deals : Experience in carveouts, distressed assets, or succession sales.
  • Financial Modeling & Analysis Skills : Advanced modeling and accounting knowledge (CPA a plus).
  • Strategic and Analytical Thinking : Able to identify risks, synergies, and value-creation opportunities.
  • Education : Bachelor’s in Finance, Accounting, or Economics. MBA, CFA, or CPA preferred.
  • Communication & Negotiation : Excellent writing and verbal communication. Fluent English; Spanish/Portuguese preferred.
  • Leadership & Collaboration : Experience managing cross-functional teams and mentoring staff.
  • Initiative and Work Ethic : Strong judgment and comfort working in ambiguous, unstructured environments.
  • Regional Experience : Familiarity with Latin American markets is a plus.


Joining Enduring Ventures as Director/VP of M&A offers the opportunity to apply world-class M&A skills in an entrepreneurial environment. You will play a pivotal role in identifying, evaluating, and acquiring exceptional businesses that we can grow and hold for the long run.


If you have the top-tier background and the hands-on drive to lead acquisitions in a unique long-term holding company model, we encourage you to apply and help build enduring value with us.

We prioritize hunger, humility, and horsepower. If you’ve built something from scratch, outworked everyone around you, or carried real weight in a high-stakes environment—we want to meet you.


Role Summary: Director/VP of M&A


We are seeking a mid- to senior-career M&A professional to lead our acquisition efforts. As the Director/VP of Mergers & Acquisitions, you will spearhead deal evaluation and execution for Enduring Ventures’ growing portfolio of companies. This is a remote role (preference for candidates based in Brazil, Colombia, or Argentina to align with our Americas operations).


You will draw on your extensive M&A experience—ideally honed at a top-tier firm (Big Four or equivalent)—to drive end-to-end deal processes. M&A expertise is absolutely critical for this position, including due diligence, financial modeling, deal preparation, and post-acquisition financial improvement initiatives.


The ideal candidate has a demonstrated history of executing deals in high-caliber environments (e.g., Big 4 transaction services or leading investment banks) and is ready to apply those skills in an entrepreneurial, long-term investment context.


What’s In It For You

  • Lead High-Impact Deals – Work directly with founders and partners on acquisitions that have real consequences.
  • Remote, Global, Flexible – Operate from anywhere while working on international deals.
  • No Bureaucracy, Full Autonomy – Own deals from end to end with a voice at the table.
  • Long-Term Capital Mindset – Buy great businesses to own forever with aligned incentives.
  • Direct Access to Decision Makers – Report directly to the Managing Partners.
  • Get Paid Like an Owner – Competitive base plus bonuses tied to long-term value creation.
  • Learn by Doing, Grow by Building – Help improve and grow real-world companies post-acquisition.
  • Mission-Aligned Culture – Join a team focused on building enduring value with discipline and purpose.


Key Responsibilities

Lead End-to-End M&A Processes

  • Manage acquisitions across a range of situations, including carveouts and distressed assets.
  • Navigate ambiguity and engage with non-institutional sellers.

Financial Due Diligence

  • Conduct rigorous diligence on targets in non-standard environments.
  • Identify hidden liabilities, off-balance-sheet risks, and working capital issues.

M&A Deal Preparation

  • Craft investment memos and financial narratives.
  • Structure deals to address seller concerns such as earn-outs and financing.

Post-Acquisition Financial Integration & Improvement

  • Stabilize and improve performance in newly acquired companies.
  • Build reporting structures and prioritize 100-day financial wins.

Financial Modeling & Valuation

  • Build and refine financial models.
  • Present valuation analyses using DCF, comparables, and ROI projections.

Negotiation & Transaction Execution

  • Lead negotiations with sellers and legal teams.
  • Maintain momentum and alignment through closing.

Cross-Functional Leadership

  • Coordinate analysts, attorneys, accountants, and consultants.
  • Mentor junior team members.

Strategic Input

  • Help refine M&A strategy.
  • Identify sectors/geographies of interest and build deal flow partnerships.

Qualifications & Experience

  • M&A Expertise : 10+ years in M&A, corporate finance, or transaction advisory. Top-tier firm experience required.
  • GAAP Accounting Fluency Required – A deep understanding of GAAP is critical for this role. You will need to assess financial statements with precision, uncover hidden liabilities, and structure deals that anticipate accounting impacts. Candidates must demonstrate fluency in U.S. GAAP and comfort analyzing non-standard or unaudited financials in complex situations.
  • Track Record of Complex Deals : Experience in carveouts, distressed assets, or succession sales.
  • Financial Modeling & Analysis Skills : Advanced modeling and accounting knowledge (CPA a plus).
  • Strategic and Analytical Thinking : Able to identify risks, synergies, and value-creation opportunities.
  • Education : Bachelor’s in Finance, Accounting, or Economics. MBA, CFA, or CPA preferred.
  • Communication & Negotiation : Excellent writing and verbal communication. Fluent English; Spanish/Portuguese preferred.
  • Leadership & Collaboration : Experience managing cross-functional teams and mentoring staff.
  • Initiative and Work Ethic : Strong judgment and comfort working in ambiguous, unstructured environments.
  • Regional Experience : Familiarity with Latin American markets is a plus.


Joining Enduring Ventures as Director/VP of M&A offers the opportunity to apply world-class M&A skills in an entrepreneurial environment. You will play a pivotal role in identifying, evaluating, and acquiring exceptional businesses that we can grow and hold for the long run.


If you have the top-tier background and the hands-on drive to lead acquisitions in a unique long-term holding company model, we encourage you to apply and help build enduring value with us.

title: Consultor de seguros
description:
Sobre a Évora Seguros

A Évora Seguros é uma empresa 100% brasileira, sendo a maior corretora de seguros do segmento de concessionárias, multimarcas e revendas. Com uma história desde 1997, além do automóvel, nosso portfólio também conta com os seguros: residencial, empresarial, auto frota, pet, fiança locatícia, além dos seguros voltados a benefícios: saúde, odonto, vida e viagem, além de consórcios. Atendemos todas as necessidades em seguros para pessoas físicas e também para empresas de todos os portes e setores. Aqui na Évora todos os candidatos que atendem aos requisitos serão considerados para a vaga independentemente de raça, cor, religião, gênero, identidade, orientação sexual, nacionalidade ou idade. Candidate-se!


Responsabilidades e atribuições

-O consultor atuará dentro de concessionária de automóvel;

- Realizar a prospecção de novos clientes;

- Atualização diária de relatórios;

- Relacionamento com os gestores Comerciais das seguradoras e equipe de vendas da concessionária.


Atendimento ao Cliente:

-Identificar as necessidades dos clientes personalizando o seguro da melhor forma;

-Explicar coberturas, benefícios, assistências e condições dos seguros oferecidos;

-Prestar suporte antes, durante e após a contratação;


Vendas Consultivas:

-Oferecer produtos personalizados conforme o perfil do cliente;

-Realizar propostas e cotações de seguros (auto);

-Cumprir metas de vendas e aproveitamento.


Requisitos e qualificações

- Graduação Completa;

- Pacote Office intermediário;

- Experiência comercial nas tratativas de clientes;

- Conhecimento em Seguros e regulamentação.


Informações adicionais:

Nossos benefícios:

- Assistência Médica e Odontológica;

- Seguro de vida em grupo;

- Vale-refeição;

- Vale-transporte ou ajuda combustível;

-Salário fixo + comissão + premiação por performance;

- Desconto na contratação de seguro automóvel.

title: Bilingual Outsystems Developer (Migration Experience) - Remote
description:
Fast Dolphin is an international staffing company with over two decades of experience specializing in recruiting bilingual and multilingual IT experts across the Americas as well as providing payroll and customized staffing solutions. Moreover, we take pride in boosting the careers and dreams of our professionals.


Recruiting a Outsystems Developer for a project in a Technology Company. Resumes to


Job Title: Outsystems Developer ( migrating from O11 to ODC )

Location: Remote – LATAM

Language: Conversational English

Contract Duration: 6 months plus extensions.


Responsibilities:


  • Participate in technical design discussions and contribute insights and innovative ideas.
  • Lead and mentor a team of software developers.
  • Collaborate with other technical teams and business analysts to ensure successful project delivery.
  • Translate business requirements into scalable, viable applications.
  • Design, develop, and test Outsystems applications using best practices and coding standards.
  • Assess and improve existing applications’ performance, architecture, and design by applying Outsystems design patterns.
  • Conduct root cause analysis to resolve defects using knowledge of applications, interfaces, and technologies.
  • Maintain professionalism and effective communication with all levels of employees.
  • Build flexible data models and ensure seamless integration points in applications.


Requirements:


  • Experience: 3 + years or more as Developer with Outsystems.
  • Education: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).
  • Must have experience migrating from O11 to ODC for both reactive and non-reactive applications
  • Strong proficiency in the Outsystems platform, including Service Studio and Integration Studio.
  • Expertise in architecture patterns, solution design, and high-performance application development.
  • Extensive experience in developing scalable, secure, and high-performance Outsystems applications.
  • Proficiency in developing screens, web blocks, timers, server/service actions, client actions, and data actions within the Outsystems environment.
  • Experience with web technologies such as ASP.NET, C#, Java, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and RESTful APIs.
  • Familiarity with relational database languages like SQL or Oracle, and experience writing T-SQL queries.
  • Experience using the Outsystems architecture dashboard and the Discovery tool to validate application design and manage technical debt.
  • Knowledge of relational data modeling principles, and experience building database objects using E-R modeling tools.
  • Proficiency in developing apps with responsive web design compatible across various devices, including experience with SOAP and RESTful APIs.
  • Experience working within agile/scrum methodologies.
  • Familiarity with project management tools such as Azure Boards, Jira, and Confluence.
  • Familiarity with Outsystems Lifetime and Service Center.
  • Ability to work independently with minimal supervision, proactively communicate status, and resolve project risks.
  • Strong problem-solving skills.
  • Preferred: Outsystems certifications such as Reactive Web Developer.
  • Preferred: Experience developing mobile applications using Outsystems.


If you fulfill this requirement and are interested in this position, please send your resume along with your availability to start in this project, to the following e-mail address:



Ligia Padilla

Talent Acquisition Lead

Fast Dolphin, Inc.

12555 Orange Drive, Suite 4059

Ft. Lauderdale, FL 33330

Phone: +1-954-289-0139

Skype: ligiapav

title: Estagiário de Turismo
description:
Estamos procurando um estagiário(a) para apoiar na criação de roteiros personalizados para clientes exigentes , em uma agência boutique localizada em Ipanema (RJ) .


 Local:  Escritório em Ipanema – 100% Presencial

   Carga horária:  6h por dia (segunda a sexta)

   Bolsa-auxílio:  R$ 1.000,00 + VT


No dia a dia, você vai:


  • Ajudar na criação de roteiros sob medida
  • Solicitar e acompanhar orçamentos com fornecedores (Brasil e exterior)
  • Preparar documentos e materiais de viagem para os clientes
  • Ter contato direto com parceiros nacionais e internacionais de alto padrão


Requisitos:


  • Inglês fluente 
  • Cursando faculdade de Turismo ou hotelaria
  • Organização, atenção aos detalhes, agilidade e boa comunicação são essenciais


Os interessados deverão enviar CV para

   Bolsa-auxílio:  R$ 1.000,00 + VT


No dia a dia, você vai:


  • Ajudar na criação de roteiros sob medida
  • Solicitar e acompanhar orçamentos com fornecedores (Brasil e exterior)
  • Preparar documentos e materiais de viagem para os clientes
  • Ter contato direto com parceiros nacionais e internacionais de alto padrão


Requisitos:


  • Inglês fluente 
  • Cursando faculdade de Turismo ou hotelaria
  • Organização, atenção aos detalhes, agilidade e boa comunicação são essenciais
